description: List resources that the runtime instance of the image lifecycle identified for lifecycle actions.

parameters.name: lifecycleExecutionId
parameters.description: Use the unique identifier for a runtime instance of the lifecycle policy to get runtime details.

parameters.name: parentResourceId
parameters.description: You can leave this empty to get a list of Image Builder resources that were identified for lifecycle actions. To get a list of associated resources that are impacted for an individual resource (the parent), specify its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Associated resources are produced from your image and distributed when you run a build, such as AMIs or container images stored in ECR repositories.

nested_items.name: lifecycleExecutionId
nested_items.description: Runtime details for the specified runtime instance of the lifecycle policy.

nested_items.name: lifecycleExecutionState
nested_items.description: The current state of the lifecycle runtime instance.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The runtime status of the lifecycle execution.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: The reason for the current status.

nested_items.name: resources
nested_items.description: A list of resources that were identified for lifecycle actions.

nested_items.name: accountId
nested_items.description: The account that owns the impacted resource.

nested_items.name: resourceId
nested_items.description: Identifies the impacted resource. The resource ID depends on the type of resource, as follows.
Image Builder image resources: Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
Distributed AMIs: AMI ID.
Container images distributed to an ECR repository: image URI or SHA Digest.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The runtime status of the lifecycle action taken for the impacted resource.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: Messaging that clarifies the reason for the assigned status.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the resource that was identified for a lifecycle policy action.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: The reason why the lifecycle policy action is taken.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the lifecycle execution resource is stored.

nested_items.name: snapshots
nested_items.description: A list of associated resource snapshots for the impacted resource if it's an AMI.

nested_items.name: snapshotId
nested_items.description: Identifies the impacted snapshot resource.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The runtime status of the lifecycle action taken for the impacted resource.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: Messaging that clarifies the reason for the assigned status.

nested_items.name: imageUris
nested_items.description: For an impacted container image, this identifies a list of URIs for associated container images distributed to ECR repositories.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: The starting timestamp from the lifecycle action that was applied to the resource.

nested_items.name: endTime
nested_items.description: The ending timestamp from the lifecycle action that was applied to the resource.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The next token used for paginated responses. When this field isn't empty, there are additional elements that the service hasn't included in this request. Use this token with the next request to retrieve additional objects.
